intro: Elatostema nanchuanense var. nigribracteolatum, commonly known as the black-bract elatostema, is a herbaceous plant native to China. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes nettle species, and is characterized by its small, opposite leaves. The plant produces tiny, greenish-white flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
